Posts.Content: shellk wrote: I am 35 years old and have one child, 2 years old.  I have been having pain in my right breast, close to nipple area.  The pain is always in the same area, about the size of a quarter.  It is internal pain, hurting when touched.  The doctor referred me for a mammogram and ultrasound.  The ultrasound tech brought in the radiologist because she saw something.  The radiologist said it was nipple shadowing and said everything looked fine.  My doctor then referred me for a MRI and that is clear.  Anyone have any thoughts on the pain?  I haven't breastfed in over 2 years, the radiologist said he saw no cysts.  It is difficult to tell if I have a lump because I am all over very lumpy and dense.  The doctor who referred me did say breast lump on the order.  I appreciate any comments.  Thanks. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: breast pain shellk annadou
